author: barnabasbusa
content: We plan to shut down peerdas-devnet-7 in a few hours. Please let us know if you are opposing this.

author: tuyen4818
content:
in lodestar we have an issue of incorrect `message-id` computed leading to very low gossip score due to p7, I'm curious if any clients team have the same issue? it's noted here https://github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/issues/7879#issuecomment-2914795390
the `message-id` function has been stable for years and I checked that it works fine till deneb, not sure how can it happen only with `data_column` topics

author: parithosh
content: oh pls check with me before you do, I haven't analyzed the sync test since last night

author: parithosh
content:
over 12h later:
Peerdas-devnet-7 sync test results (all supernodes, checkpoint sync was used):
Teku-nethermind: Synced (i cant make sense of this msg though: `completed: 166512, errored: 1550906,  total pending: 0, active pending: 0, new active`)
Nimbus-nethermind: Synced,
Prysm-nethermind: Synced,
Lighthouse-nethermind: Synced,
Teku-reth: Synced,
Prysm-reth: Synced,
Nimbus-reth: Synced,
Teku-geth: Synced,
Prysm-geth: Synced,
Lighthouse-geth: Synced,

Grandine-nethermind: Syncing,
Lodestar-nethermind: Syncing,
Grandine-reth: Syncing,
Lighthouse-reth: Syncing (it was synced before, now its unsynced and catching up)
Lodestar-reth: Syncing,
Grandine-geth: Syncing,
Lodestar-geth: Syncing,


Nimbus-geth: Crashed (logs attached)

author: parithosh
content:
My TLDR for the sync tests:
- Grandine/Lodestar are unable to sync to head, this should be easily reproducible
- Lighthouse-reth is likely a one-off, but maybe some hidden peering bug? I am running like 20 nodes on one IP, so it could just be random

author: parithosh
content: I will remove the nodes now, i dont think more time will change anything at this point. ANNNDD i think we need to think about how to speed up sync, most nodes sync up fast but clearly waiting more time helped the others.

author: manunlp
content:
Also, I think a full node should be able to sync even if it has some columns not costodied by any of its peers. (Very bad situation, but it may happen in very degraded network.)
Aka, a node should be able to sync in the "perfect peerdas" kurtosis configuration.

author: parithosh
content: Are we fine with deleting peerdas-devnet-7 then? we can continue the sync tests with a nicer tool on fusaka-devnet-0
